source: Compiled from major Veteran scholarship programs and directories
description: Scholarships specifically for Veterans, active duty service members, and military families pursuing higher education

scholarships.name: Pat Tillman Foundation Scholars Program
eligibility: Active duty service members
Veterans of all branches
Spouses of service members or Veterans
scholarships.description: Provides educational scholarships to military Veterans and spouses who demonstrate leadership potential and a commitment to service beyond self. Scholars join a network of over 700 Tillman Scholars making an impact in their communities.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Submit online application through the Pat Tillman Foundation website. Application includes essays, resume, and recommendations.
scholarships.notes: Named after NFL player and Army Ranger Pat Tillman. One of the most prestigious Veteran scholarships.

scholarships.name: Folds of Honor Scholarship
eligibility: Spouses and children of fallen or disabled service members
Veterans with service-connected disabilities
Active duty service members
scholarships.description: Provides educational scholarships to spouses and children of America's fallen and disabled service members. Supports K-12 private school tuition and higher education.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply online through the Folds of Honor website. Requires proof of military service or disability status.
scholarships.notes: Has awarded over $240 million in educational scholarships since 2007.

scholarships.name: VFW Sport Clips Help A Hero Scholarship
eligibility: Veterans who served during a period of war
Currently enrolled in or accepted to an accredited program
Must have served in a combat zone
scholarships.description: Provides scholarships to service members and Veterans who are transitioning to civilian life. Funded through partnership between VFW and Sport Clips.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through VFW website. Requires VFW member sponsor, DD-214, and proof of enrollment.
scholarships.notes: Sport Clips has raised over $10 million for Veteran scholarships.

scholarships.name: American Legion Legacy Scholarship
scholarships.amount: Up to $20,000 (renewable up to $5,000/year for 4 years)
eligibility: Children of post-9/11 Veterans who died on active duty
Children of post-9/11 Veterans with VA disability rating of 50% or higher
Must be pursuing undergraduate degree
scholarships.description: Provides scholarships to children of post-9/11 fallen or disabled Veterans. Recognizes the sacrifice of military families.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through The American Legion website. Requires proof of parent's service and disability rating or death certificate.
scholarships.notes: One of the largest scholarships specifically for children of post-9/11 Veterans.

scholarships.name: Edith Nourse Rogers STEM Scholarship
scholarships.amount: Up to $30,000 (extension of Post-9/11 GI Bill)
eligibility: Veterans using Post-9/11 GI Bill benefits
Must be enrolled in STEM program
Less than 6 months of GI Bill benefits remaining
scholarships.description: Extends Post-9/11 GI Bill benefits for Veterans pursuing degrees in science, technology, engineering, and math fields. Provides up to 9 months of additional benefits.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through VA.gov or through your school's Veterans certifying official.
scholarships.notes: Official VA program. Named after Congresswoman Edith Nourse Rogers, first woman to serve in Congress from Massachusetts.

scholarships.name: DAV National Education Scholarships
eligibility: DAV members or dependents
Children of Veterans who are DAV life members
Pursuing undergraduate or graduate education
scholarships.description: Multiple scholarship programs supporting disabled Veterans and their families in pursuing educational goals.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through DAV chapter or national website. Requirements vary by specific scholarship.
scholarships.notes: Multiple programs available through local DAV chapters.

scholarships.name: AMVETS National Scholarship Program
eligibility: Veterans who served during qualifying period
Active National Guard and Reserve members
JROTC cadets (for JROTC scholarship)
scholarships.description: Multiple scholarship programs including the AMVETS National Scholarship for Veterans pursuing higher education.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through AMVETS website. Requires proof of service and academic records.
scholarships.notes: AMVETS also offers scholarships specifically for spouses and children.

scholarships.name: Tillman Scholars Military Spouse Program
eligibility: Spouses of active duty service members
Spouses of Veterans
Must be pursuing degree or certificate
scholarships.description: Dedicated scholarship track for military spouses pursuing education. Part of the broader Tillman Scholars program.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through the Pat Tillman Foundation website as part of the Tillman Scholars application.
scholarships.notes: Recognizes the unique challenges military spouses face in pursuing education.

scholarships.name: Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation
eligibility: Children of Marines and Navy Corpsmen
Parent must have served honorably
Financial need considered
scholarships.description: Provides need-based scholarships to children of Marines and Navy Corpsmen. Has awarded over $165 million since 1962.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply online through the Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation website.
scholarships.notes: Largest provider of need-based scholarships for Marine and Navy families.

scholarships.name: Army Women's Foundation Legacy Scholarship
eligibility: Women who served or are serving in the U.S. Army
Daughters and granddaughters of Army women
Active duty, Reserve, or National Guard women
scholarships.description: Supports women soldiers and their descendants in pursuing higher education.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through the Army Women's Foundation website with proof of service.
scholarships.notes: Celebrates the legacy of women who have served in the U.S. Army.

scholarships.name: Air Force Aid Society Education Grants
eligibility: Dependents of active duty Air Force and Space Force members
Dependents of Air Force Veterans
Spouses of active duty members
scholarships.description: Provides grants and loans for education to Air Force and Space Force families.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through the Air Force Aid Society portal.
scholarships.notes: Also provides emergency assistance beyond education grants.

scholarships.name: Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society Education Assistance
eligibility: Children of active duty or retired Navy and Marine Corps service members
Spouses of active duty members
Children of deceased service members
scholarships.description: Interest-free loans and grants for higher education for Navy and Marine Corps families.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through NMCRS website or local Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society office.
scholarships.notes: Offers both loans and grants based on financial need.

scholarships.name: Coast Guard Foundation Scholarships
eligibility: Children of Coast Guard members
Coast Guard active duty, reserve, or retired members
Spouses of Coast Guard members
scholarships.description: Multiple scholarship programs supporting Coast Guard families in pursuing education.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through the Coast Guard Foundation website.
scholarships.notes: The Coast Guard Foundation provides comprehensive support beyond scholarships.

scholarships.name: Fisher House Foundation Scholarship
eligibility: Children of active duty service members
Children of Veterans
Children of service members who died during active duty
scholarships.description: Supports the educational pursuits of military children through various scholarship programs.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through Scholarships for Military Children program at participating commissaries.
scholarships.notes: Fisher House is best known for providing housing near VA and military hospitals.

scholarships.name: VetSuccess Student Veteran Support
eligibility: Veterans using VA education benefits
Enrolled at participating schools
May have barriers to education completion
scholarships.description: Provides on-campus support through VetSuccess counselors who help with VA benefits, academic challenges, and career planning.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Contact your school's Veterans services office or VetSuccess on Campus counselor.
scholarships.notes: Available at over 100 college campuses nationwide.

scholarships.name: Yellow Ribbon Program
scholarships.amount: Varies by school (covers tuition beyond GI Bill limits)
eligibility: 100% Post-9/11 GI Bill eligible Veterans
Enrolled at a Yellow Ribbon participating school
Active duty service members transferred benefits to dependents
scholarships.description: Participating schools agree to contribute funds to cover tuition that exceeds the GI Bill maximum. VA matches the school's contribution.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through the school's Veterans services office. Check VA website for participating schools.
scholarships.notes: Over 2,000 schools participate in the Yellow Ribbon Program.

scholarships.name: Troops to Teachers STEM Scholarship
scholarships.organization: Defense Activity for Non-Traditional Education Support (DANTES)
eligibility: Veterans transitioning to teaching careers
Focus on high-need subjects (math, science, special education)
Must agree to teach in high-need schools
scholarships.description: Provides stipends to Veterans pursuing teaching certification, with focus on STEM subjects in high-need schools.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Register with Troops to Teachers program and apply through DANTES.
scholarships.notes: Part of the Troops to Teachers program which has helped over 30,000 Veterans become teachers.

scholarships.name: SkillBridge Higher Education Programs
eligibility: Active duty service members
Within 180 days of separation
Participating in approved program
scholarships.description: Allows active duty service members to participate in civilian job training, education, and internships during last 180 days of service while continuing to receive military pay.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Coordinate with your transition assistance office and find approved programs on SkillBridge website.
scholarships.notes: Many SkillBridge programs include education components alongside job training.

scholarships.name: Paralyzed Veterans of America (PVA) Scholarship
eligibility: PVA members
Spouses and children of PVA members
Pursuing undergraduate or graduate degree
scholarships.description: Scholarships for paralyzed Veterans and their families pursuing higher education.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through PVA website with proof of membership and enrollment.
scholarships.notes: PVA advocates for Veterans with spinal cord injuries and disorders.

scholarships.name: MOAA Scholarship Fund
eligibility: Children of military officers (all branches)
Children of enlisted personnel
Must be undergraduate students
scholarships.description: Interest-free loans and grants for children of military personnel, based on financial need and academic achievement.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through the MOAA website with academic records and financial information.
scholarships.notes: MOAA has provided over $133 million in scholarships since 1948.

aggregator_sites.name: Military.com Scholarship Finder
aggregator_sites.description: Comprehensive database of military and Veteran scholarships searchable by branch, eligibility, and field of study.

aggregator_sites.name: Fastweb Military Scholarships
aggregator_sites.description: Free scholarship search engine with dedicated military and Veteran scholarship listings.

aggregator_sites.name: Student Veterans of America Resource Hub
aggregator_sites.description: Resources and scholarship information specifically for student Veterans at member institutions.

aggregator_sites.name: VA Education Benefits Hub
aggregator_sites.description: Official VA resource for all education benefits including GI Bill, VR&E, and scholarship information.
